sentence: Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) will begin trading ex-dividend on March 10, 2015.
A cash dividend payment of $0.59 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 26, 2015.
Shareholders who purchased HD prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 25.53% increase over the prior quarter.
The previous trading day's last sale of HD was $114.45, representing a -2.94% decrease from the 52 week high of $117.92 and a 53.4% increase over the 52 week low of $74.61.
HD is a part of the Consumer Services sector, which includes companies such as Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ) and Sherwin-Williams Company ( SHW ).
HD's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $4.72.
Zacks Investment Research reports HD's forecasted earnings growth in 2016 as 13.76%, compared to an industry average of 8.3%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the HD Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
